intro: Qualea amoena, commonly known as the pink river apple, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are edible and contain a sweet, fleshy pulp. Qualea amoena thrives in wetland and swampy environments, often growing along riverbanks. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in the biodiversity of the Amazon.
